segment.source: Evaluating MBAM 2.0
segment.target: Evaluating MBAM 2.0

segment.source: Evaluating MBAM 2.0
segment.target: Evaluating MBAM 2.0

segment.source: Evaluating MBAM 2.0
segment.target: Evaluating MBAM 2.0

segment.source: Before deploying Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) into a production environment, you should evaluate it in a test environment.
segment.target: Before deploying Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) into a production environment, you should evaluate it in a test environment.

segment.source: The information in this topic can be used to set up Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring with a Stand-alone topology in a single-server test environment for evaluation purposes only.
segment.target: The information in this topic can be used to set up Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring with a Stand-alone topology in a single-server test environment for evaluation purposes only.

segment.source: A single-server topology is not recommended for production environments.
segment.target: A single-server topology is not recommended for production environments.

segment.source: For instructions on deploying MBAM in a test environment, see How to Install and Configure MBAM on a Single Server.
segment.target: For instructions on deploying MBAM in a test environment, see How to Install and Configure MBAM on a Single Server.

segment.source: Setting up the Test Environment
segment.target: Setting up the Test Environment

segment.source: Even though you are setting up a non-production instance of MBAM to evaluate in a test environment, you should still verify that you have met the prerequisites and hardware and software requirements.
segment.target: Even though you are setting up a non-production instance of MBAM to evaluate in a test environment, you should still verify that you have met the prerequisites and hardware and software requirements.

segment.source: Before you start the installation, see MBAM 2.0 Deployment Prerequisites, MBAM 2.0 Supported Configurations, and Preparing your Environment for MBAM 2.0.
segment.target: Before you start the installation, see MBAM 2.0 Deployment Prerequisites, MBAM 2.0 Supported Configurations, and Preparing your Environment for MBAM 2.0.

segment.source: After completing the necessary planning and software prerequisite installations to prepare your computing environment for the MBAM installation, you can begin the MBAM evaluation deployment.
segment.target: After completing the necessary planning and software prerequisite installations to prepare your computing environment for the MBAM installation, you can begin the MBAM evaluation deployment.

segment.source: Review the MBAM supported configurations information to make sure that selected client and server computers are supported for MBAM feature installation.
segment.target: Review the MBAM supported configurations information to make sure that selected client and server computers are supported for MBAM feature installation.

segment.source: MBAM 2.0 Supported Configurations
segment.target: MBAM 2.0 Supported Configurations

segment.source: Run MBAM Setup to deploy MBAM Server features on a single server for evaluation purposes.
segment.target: Run MBAM Setup to deploy MBAM Server features on a single server for evaluation purposes.

segment.source: How to Install and Configure MBAM on a Single Server
segment.target: How to Install and Configure MBAM on a Single Server

segment.source: Add Active Directory Domain Services security groups, that you created during the planning phase, to the appropriate local MBAM Server feature local groups on the new MBAM Server.
segment.target: Add Active Directory Domain Services security groups, that you created during the planning phase, to the appropriate local MBAM Server feature local groups on the new MBAM Server.

segment.source: Configure Lab Computers for MBAM Evaluation
segment.target: Configure Lab Computers for MBAM Evaluation

segment.source: This section contains information that can be used to speed up the MBAM Client status reporting.
segment.target: This section contains information that can be used to speed up the MBAM Client status reporting.

segment.source: However, these modifications should be used for testing purposes only.
segment.target: However, these modifications should be used for testing purposes only.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The information in following section describes how to modify the Windows registry.
segment.target: The information in following section describes how to modify the Windows registry.

segment.source: Using Registry Editor incorrectly can cause serious problems that may require you to reinstall Windows.
segment.target: Using Registry Editor incorrectly can cause serious problems that may require you to reinstall Windows.

segment.source: Microsoft cannot guarantee that problems resulting from the incorrect use of Registry Editor can be solved.
segment.target: Microsoft cannot guarantee that problems resulting from the incorrect use of Registry Editor can be solved.

segment.source: Use Registry Editor at your own risk.
segment.target: Use Registry Editor at your own risk.

segment.source: Modify MBAM Client Status Reporting Frequency Settings
segment.target: Modify MBAM Client Status Reporting Frequency Settings

segment.source: The MBAM Client wakeup and status reporting frequencies have a minimum value of 90 minutes when they are set using Group Policy.
segment.target: The MBAM Client wakeup and status reporting frequencies have a minimum value of 90 minutes when they are set using Group Policy.

segment.source: You can use the Windows registry to change these frequencies to a lower value on MBAM client computers to help speed up testing.
segment.target: You can use the Windows registry to change these frequencies to a lower value on MBAM client computers to help speed up testing.

segment.source: To modify the MBAM Client status reporting frequency settings:
segment.target: To modify the MBAM Client status reporting frequency settings:

segment.source: Use a registry editor to navigate to HKLMSoftwarePoliciesMicrosoftFVEMDOPBitLockerManagement.
segment.target: Use a registry editor to navigate to HKLMSoftwarePoliciesMicrosoftFVEMDOPBitLockerManagement.

segment.source: Change the values for ClientWakeupFrequency and StatusReportingFrequency to 1 as the minimum client-supported value.
segment.target: Change the values for ClientWakeupFrequency and StatusReportingFrequency to 1 as the minimum client-supported value.

segment.source: This change causes the MBAM Client to report every minute.
segment.target: This change causes the MBAM Client to report every minute.

segment.source: Restart BitLocker Management Client Service.
segment.target: Restart BitLocker Management Client Service.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To set values that are this low, you must set them in the registry manually.
segment.target: To set values that are this low, you must set them in the registry manually.

segment.source: Modify MBAM Client Service Startup Delay
segment.target: Modify MBAM Client Service Startup Delay

segment.source: In addition to the MBAM Client wakeup and status reporting frequencies, there is a random delay of up to 90 minutes when the MBAM Client agent service starts on client computers.
segment.target: In addition to the MBAM Client wakeup and status reporting frequencies, there is a random delay of up to 90 minutes when the MBAM Client agent service starts on client computers.

segment.source: If you do not want the random delay, create a DWORD value of NoStartupDelay under HKLMSoftwareMicrosoftMBAM, set its value to 1, and then restart BitLocker Management Client Service.
segment.target: If you do not want the random delay, create a DWORD value of NoStartupDelay under HKLMSoftwareMicrosoftMBAM, set its value to 1, and then restart BitLocker Management Client Service.
